text: Which of the following is NOT a feature of a good topic sentence?

options.A: It states both the topic and the focus clearly.
options.B: It may contain more than one controlling idea to provide variety.
options.C: It is a complete sentence, not a phrase.
options.D: It avoids being a question form.
options.E: It should not be a well-known fact but should assert an idea.

explanation:
The book explicitly states that having more than one focus will cause the writer to lose control, confuse the reader, and make the paragraph less clear. Therefore, “more than one controlling idea” is not a desirable feature. The other features of a good topic sentence are;
  • Topic + focus must be clear (e.g., "Travelling by plane has become much cheaper").
  • It must be a complete sentence, not a phrase.
  • It should not be in the form of a question.
  • It should assert an idea, not just state a known fact.
